The sides are parallel and the top and bottom faces are perpendicular to the sides. The dimensions of the sides are equal and the height is half the width. Begin by creating a new coordinate system in the following position and orientation: * Euler Angles: [0.0, 0.0, -90.0] * Translation Vector: [0.0, 0.0354, 0.0] Now, create the 2D sketch for this part on the XY plane of the new coordinate system. 2D Sketch Details The sketch consists of a single face (face_1) with one loop (loop_1). The loop has six line segments as follows (note the direction of the lines): 1. line_1: Start Point = [0.0, 0.75], End Point = [0.248, 0.75] 2. line_2: Start Point = [0.248, 0.75], End Point = [0.4961, 0.75] 3. line_3: Start Point = [0.4961, 0.75], End Point = [0.4754, 0.0] 4. line_4: Start Point = [0.4754, 0.0], End Point = [0.248, 0.0] 5. line_5: Start Point = [0.248, 0.0], End Point = [0.0207, 0.0] 6. line_6: Start Point = [0.0207, 0.0], End Point = [0.0, 0.75] Apply the necessary constraints to ensure the loop is closed. Next, transform the 2D sketch into a 3D sketch using the following transformation data: * Euler Angles: [0.0, 0.0, -90.0] * Translation Vector: [0.0, 0.0354, 0.0] Once the sketch is transformed, extrude it along the normal direction to generate a 3D solid with the specified dimensions. The extrusion properties are as follows: * Extrude Depth towards Normal: 0.0354 * Extrude Depth opposite Normal: 0.0 * Sketch Scale: 0.75 After extruding the sketch, the resulting solid represents the first part of the CAD assembly. The dimensions for the shape are as follows: * Length: 0.75 * Width: 0.0354 * Height: 0.75</description>
